009package ImageJ_Demos;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.core.plugin.JavaDocHelp;
015
016/**
017 * This ImageJ plugin shows how data can be communicated from one
018 * plugin to another. In this example, THIS plugin ({@link Data_Transfer_Plugin_Producer})
019 * calculates a histogram that is subsequently retrieved by ANOTHER
020 * plugin {@link Data_Transfer_Plugin_Consumer}. 
021 * Data are stored as a <strong>property</strong> of the associated image (of type {@link ImagePlus}).
022 * Note that the stored data should contain no instances of self-defined
023 * classes, since these may be re-loaded when performing compile-and-run.
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 *
027 */
028public class Data_Transfer_Plugin_Producer implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
029        
030        // Create a unique (publicly visible) property key:
031        public static final String HistKey = 
032                        Data_Transfer_Plugin_Producer.class.getCanonicalName() + "histogram";
033        
034        ImagePlus im;
035        
036        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
037                this.im = im;
038                return DOES_ALL + NO_CHANGES;}
039                
040        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
041                int[] hist = ip.getHistogram();
042                // add histogram to image properties:
043                im.setProperty(HistKey, hist);
044        }
045}
